channel.title: Which do you think is better
channel.description: yup, what do you think is the best?

item.title: Which do you think is better
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:32, topic:14687”]Windows…

Worst security, resource hog, limited games (since on Linux you can use a Windows Emulator and play both Linux and Windows games), crappiest look ever, worst programs preinstalled, worst uninstaller (leaves like 5000 undeleted unused registry entries when you install something), billions of spyware, and yet 25 people voted for Windows.

Just goes to show how many people are ignorant. :P[/quote]

Ron, I have Ubuntu 6.06 installed on a partition. I have had ENOUGH trouble getting a secure wireless up and running on windows, I REALLY don’t want to go through the trouble of setting up a windows emulator to find out it won’t/dosen’t work on windows. I don’t want to find out that I can’t install my drivers on linux, since I needed to format my windows and crappy dell didn’t include my Driver disks.

So, witch should I vote for? Windows where I KNOW my wireless, drives and almost all my programs will work, or Linux with no internet and alot of my programs will work?

Yes, I agree, Linux is just better on windows, but I don’t want to waste time to see what emulators I need for what I got. I have enough trouble looking through Dell’s crappy support to see what drivers/devices I need to reinstall my graphics card into my windows to find emulators it will work on aswell.

Read full topic
item.source: Which do you think is better

item.title: Which do you think is better
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

sidishere:

isnt linux slower than windows??? and is it free…i think it is [br][size=1]Posted at: September 19, 2006, 12:13:34 PM[/size][hr]so basicly the main reason linux is better is that it’s hard to get viruses on it…???

Linux is ALOT lighter than windows. I can recall 8~GB of HD space used by windows, and Linux(Unbutu) only needs 2GB~. Alot, if not most(with the exception of 2-4~) viruses won’t work on Linux. That means you don’t need anti virus, just don’t run files from stupid sites, but you shouldn’t do that anyway. I got 5(yes 5) ubuntu CD’s shipped from USA to UK absolutly free. I will tell you one thing about unbutu, it’s secksy.

Also, by using most Linux distros you won’t get crappy programs that want you to register after 30 days. On the CD you get just the basics needed to run a comp, but it’s better than 430754 un-needed programs that even paint looks down upon.

I voted windows, yes, because to run linux on a windows comp for example, you need to partition your HD and make a boot-screen(alot of the time). It’s a big learning curve to switch, but linux is alot more stable. In my opinion, if you can switch to linux, do it. If you don’t like it, then you can delete the partition it’s on and boom, it goes!

Read full topic
